Instruction: In the file "AB12CD.pdf", on page 3, within the second rectangle, add a table with the following content: first row "Beam, Length, Material"; second row "B1, 5m, Steel"; third row "B2, 7m, Concrete"; set the font to "Arial" and font size to 12.
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "AB12CD.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 2  # Page 3 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 1  # Second rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Beam", "Length", "Material"], ["B1", "5m", "Steel"], ["B2", "7m", "Concrete"]],
    font="Arial",
    fontsize=12
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

# Task 1
# file-level
filepath = "AB12CD.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# page-level
pagenumber = 2  # page 3 (0-indexed)

# order-level
rectangleorder = 1  # second rectangle (0-indexed)

# Extract target position
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# base-level
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Beam", "Length", "Material"], ["B1", "5m", "Steel"], ["B2", "7m", "Concrete"]],
    font="Arial",
    fontsize=12
)

# Add table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save updated file
updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)

Instruction: In the file "EF34GH.pdf", on page 8, within the fourth rectangle, add a table with the following content: first row "Column, Height"; second row "C1, 3m"; third row "C2, 4.5m"; adjust the row heights to [25, 20, 20].
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "EF34GH.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 7  # Page 8 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 3  # Fourth rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Column", "Height"], ["C1", "3m"], ["C2", "4.5m"]],
    arrange=[[25, 20, 20], None]
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    arrange=argument.get("arrange")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task 1
# file-level
filepath = "EF34GH.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# page-level
pagenumber = 7  # page 8 (0-indexed)

# order-level
rectangleorder = 3  # fourth rectangle (0-indexed)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# base-level
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Column", "Height"], ["C1", "3m"], ["C2", "4.5m"]],
    arrange=[[25, 20, 20], None]
)

# table adding
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    arrange=argument.get("arrange")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# save the updated file
updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)

Instruction: In the file "IJ56KL.pdf", on page 15, within the first rectangle, add a table with the following content: first row "Load, Type, Value"; second row "Dead, Uniform, 10kN/m"; third row "Live, Point, 5kN".
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "IJ56KL.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 14  # Page 15 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 0  # First rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Load", "Type", "Value"], ["Dead", "Uniform", "10kN/m"], ["Live", "Point", "5kN"]]
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

# base-level

    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Load", "Type", "Value"], ["Dead", "Uniform", "10kN/m"], ["Live", "Point", "5kN"]]

# Add table
